problem_text: In the figure, G K \cong G H and H K \cong K J. If m \angle H G K = 42, find m \angle H J K.
compact_text: In the figure, GK \cong GH and HK \cong KJ. If m \angle HGK = 42, find m \angle HJK.
annotat_text: In the figure, $ \overline{GK} \cong \overline{GH}$ and $ \overline{HK} \cong \overline{KJ}$. If $m \angle HGK=42$, find $m \angle HJK$.
